Reported by Reuters Top News, France24, Al Jazeera and others

items.title: Hamas Rejects Vital Conditions of Donald Trump’s Gaza Peace Plan
items.standfirst: After the United Nations Security Council endorsed the U.S. peace plan developed under President Donald Trump's leadership, Hamas rejected two of its vital conditions—the militant group's immediate disarmament and what it called the "international guardianship mechanism". Phase One of the Trump…
items.content: After the United Nations Security Council endorsed the U.S. peace plan developed under President Donald Trump's leadership, Hamas rejected two of its vital conditions—the militant group's immediate disarmament and what it called the "international guardianship mechanism". Phase One of the Trump…

items.title: UN security council approves US Gaza plan
items.standfirst: The US resolution that passed the UN Security Council authorises an international stabilization force to provide security in Gaza, approves a transitional authority to be overseen by President Donald Trump and envisions a possible future path to an independent Palestinian state. France24 correspondent Noga Tarnopolsky tells us the latest.
items.content: The US resolution that passed the UN Security Council authorises an international stabilization force to provide security in Gaza, approves a transitional authority to be overseen by President Donald Trump and envisions a possible future path to an independent Palestinian state. France24 correspondent Noga Tarnopolsky tells us the latest.

items.title: UN Security Council approves US resolution backing Trump’s Gaza plan
items.standfirst: UNSC backs US plan, approving a stabilisation force and ‘board of peace’ to oversee Gaza’s governance and rebuilding.
items.content: UNSC backs US plan, approving a stabilisation force and ‘board of peace’ to oversee Gaza’s governance and rebuilding.

items.title: UN security council approves the Trump administration's plan for the future of Gaza
items.standfirst: The Trump administration’s blueprint to secure and govern Gaza won strong approval at the United Nations on Monday, a crucial step that provides international support for U.S. efforts to move the devastated territory toward peace following two years of war. France24 correspondent Jessica Le Masurier tells us the latest.
items.content: The Trump administration’s blueprint to secure and govern Gaza won strong approval at the United Nations on Monday, a crucial step that provides international support for U.S. efforts to move the devastated territory toward peace following two years of war. France24 correspondent Jessica Le Masurier tells us the latest.

items.title: UN approves US plan authorising international stabilisation force in Gaza
items.standfirst: The United Nations Security Council on Monday approved a United States plan for Gaza that authorises an international stabilisation force and outlines a potential route towards an independent Palestinian state, marking a significant step for the fragile ceasefire after more than two years of war.
items.content: The United Nations Security Council on Monday approved a United States plan for Gaza that authorises an international stabilisation force and outlines a potential route towards an independent Palestinian state, marking a significant step for the fragile ceasefire after more than two years of war.

items.title: One of the oddest UN resolutions in history seeks to solidify shaky Gaza ceasefire into an enduring peace
items.standfirst: The hazy UN resolution dictates that Trump’s ‘board of peace’ will supervise an International Stabilisation Force, whose membership is as yet undeterminedThe resolution passed by the UN security council on Tuesday evening, aimed at turning the precarious Gaza ceasefire into a real peace plan, is one of the oddest in United Nations history.It puts Donald Trump in supreme control of Gaza, perhaps with Tony Blair as his immediate subordinate in a “board of peace”, which will oversee multinational peacekeeping troops, a committee of Palestinian technocrats and a local police force, for a period of two years. Continue reading...
items.content: The hazy UN resolution dictates that Trump’s ‘board of peace’ will supervise an International Stabilisation Force, whose membership is as yet undeterminedThe resolution passed by the UN security council on Tuesday evening, aimed at turning the precarious Gaza ceasefire into a real peace plan, is one of the oddest in United Nations history.It puts Donald Trump in supreme control of Gaza, perhaps with Tony Blair as his immediate subordinate in a “board of peace”, which will oversee multinational peacekeeping troops, a committee of Palestinian technocrats and a local police force, for a period of two years. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump's plan for Gaza backed by UN Security Council
items.standfirst: Included in the 20-point peace plan is the establishment of an International Stabilisation Force (ISF), which would work to demilitarise the territory.
items.content: Included in the 20-point peace plan is the establishment of an International Stabilisation Force (ISF), which would work to demilitarise the territory.

items.title: U.N. Security Council approves U.S.-brokered Gaza peace plan
items.standfirst: The U.N. Security Council has approved a U.S. plan for Gaza that authorizes an international stabilization force to provide security in the Palestinian territory.
items.content: The U.N. Security Council has approved a U.S. plan for Gaza that authorizes an international stabilization force to provide security in the Palestinian territory.

items.title: U.N. Security Council adopts U.S. resolution on Gaza plan
items.standfirst: The United Nations Security Council has voted to adopt a U.S. resolution outlining President Trump's peace plan for post-war Gaza. CBS News senior foreign correspondent Holly Williams has the details.
items.content: The United Nations Security Council has voted to adopt a U.S. resolution outlining President Trump's peace plan for post-war Gaza. CBS News senior foreign correspondent Holly Williams has the details.

items.title: UN security council votes to endorse Donald Trump’s Gaza plan
items.standfirst: The resolution, which includes references to an independent Palestine, was passed by a vote of 13-0 with China and Russia abstaining The UN security council has endorsed proposals put forward by Donald Trump for a lasting peace in Gaza, including the deployment of an international stabilisation force and a possible path to a sovereign Palestinian state.The resolution, passed by a vote of 13-0 with abstentions by China and Russia, charted “a new course in the Middle East for Israelis and Palestinians and all the people of the region alike”, the US envoy to the UN, Mike Waltz, told the council chamber. Continue reading...
items.content: The resolution, which includes references to an independent Palestine, was passed by a vote of 13-0 with China and Russia abstaining The UN security council has endorsed proposals put forward by Donald Trump for a lasting peace in Gaza, including the deployment of an international stabilisation force and a possible path to a sovereign Palestinian state.The resolution, passed by a vote of 13-0 with abstentions by China and Russia, charted “a new course in the Middle East for Israelis and Palestinians and all the people of the region alike”, the US envoy to the UN, Mike Waltz, told the council chamber. Continue reading...

items.title: The U.N. Security Council approves a U.S. plan for a Gaza stabilization force
items.standfirst: The plan authorizes a security force in the devastated territory and envisions a possible path to an independent Palestinian state. Russia, which had circulated a rival resolution, abstained along with China on the 13-0 vote.
items.content: The plan authorizes a security force in the devastated territory and envisions a possible path to an independent Palestinian state. Russia, which had circulated a rival resolution, abstained along with China on the 13-0 vote.(Image credit: Abdel Kareem Hana)

items.title: UN Security Council passes US resolution backing international Gaza force
items.standfirst: Measure mandates transitional administration for Gaza and floats 'credible pathway' for Palestinian statehood.
items.content: Measure mandates transitional administration for Gaza and floats 'credible pathway' for Palestinian statehood.

items.title: 'A moment of true historic proportion': Trump welcomes UN vote on Gaza peace plan
items.standfirst: The UN Security Council has passed a US-drafted resolution which supports Donald Trump's peace plan for Gaza.
items.content: The UN Security Council has passed a US-drafted resolution which supports Donald Trump's peace plan for Gaza.

items.title: UN approves US plan authorising international stabilisation force in Gaza
items.standfirst: The United Nations Security Council on Monday approved a United States plan for Gaza authorising an international stabilisation force and outlining a potential route towards an independent Palestinian state, marking a significant step for the fragile ceasefire after more than two years of war.
items.content: The United Nations Security Council on Monday approved a United States plan for Gaza authorising an international stabilisation force and outlining a potential route towards an independent Palestinian state, marking a significant step for the fragile ceasefire after more than two years of war.

items.title: UN to vote on Gaza stabilisation force plan that references Palestinian state
items.standfirst: Netanyahu faces pressure from far-right ministers after Saudi insistence on ‘credible pathway’ to statehoodThe UN security council is to vote on Monday on a US-drafted resolution to set up an international stabilisation force (ISF) in Gaza that includes a late and highly tentative addition on a future Palestinian state, added under pressure from Arab states.A rival motion has meanwhile been tabled by Russia and China, setting up the possibility that both motions could be vetoed by one or more of the five permanent members of the security council. Continue reading...
items.content: Netanyahu faces pressure from far-right ministers after Saudi insistence on ‘credible pathway’ to statehoodThe UN security council is to vote on Monday on a US-drafted resolution to set up an international stabilisation force (ISF) in Gaza that includes a late and highly tentative addition on a future Palestinian state, added under pressure from Arab states.A rival motion has meanwhile been tabled by Russia and China, setting up the possibility that both motions could be vetoed by one or more of the five permanent members of the security council. Continue reading...

items.title: U.N. Security Council approves Trump's Gaza peace plan
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump’s Gaza peace plan was passed by a majority vote at the United Nations on Monday, though world powers were still divided over whether it can convert a fragile ceasefire into the long-term solution that has eluded the Middle East
items.content: President Donald Trump’s Gaza peace plan was passed by a majority vote at the United Nations on Monday, though world powers were still divided over whether it can convert a fragile ceasefire into the long-term solution that has eluded the Middle East

items.title: House of Representatives to vote on release of Epstein files after Trump U-turn – US politics live
items.standfirst: Move comes after Donald Trump dropped his opposition to a vote on releasing files on the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey EpsteinFull report: House set to vote on release of Epstein documentsExplainer: what to know about the US House voteThis is one of the emails released last week by Democrats which have put attention back on Trump and his history with Epstein. In it, Epstein wrote that Trump “knew about the girls”.In another email, Epstein wrote that Trump “spent hours” with one of the victims at his house, and another email referred to the president as “dirty.” Continue reading...

In it, Epstein wrote that Trump “knew about the girls”.In another email, Epstein wrote that Trump “spent hours” with one of the victims at his house, and another email referred to the president as “dirty.” Continue reading...

items.title: Will more Epstein files be released? House vote adds pressure on Trump's DOJ.
items.standfirst: The measure compelling the Justice Department to release materials related to Jeffrey Epstein is expected to pass the House. In a sudden reversal, President Trump told lawmakers they should vote for it.
items.content: The measure compelling the Justice Department to release materials related to Jeffrey Epstein is expected to pass the House. In a sudden reversal, President Trump told lawmakers they should vote for it.

items.title: US House expected to pass bill forcing Epstein files’ release
items.standfirst: The House is expected to pass a bill today requiring the Justice Department to release its files on sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, with enough bipartisan support to override a veto. It may be a moot point: President Donald Trump said Monday he would sign the legislation if the Senate passes it,…
items.content: The House is expected to pass a bill today requiring the Justice Department to release its files on sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, with enough bipartisan support to override a veto. It may be a moot point: President Donald Trump said Monday he would sign the legislation if the Senate passes it,…

items.title: House set to vote on release of Epstein documents after Trump U-turn
items.standfirst: President drops opposition to vote that would compel files’ release and says he would sign measure if it reaches his deskUS politics live: House to vote on release of Epstein filesThe Republican-controlled US House of Representatives is expected to vote on Tuesday to force the release of investigative files related to pedophile Jeffrey Epstein, the latest move in a scandal that has dogged Donald Trump since he returned to the White House.In a sharp reversal this weekend, Trump dropped his opposition to a vote releasing files from the criminal investigation by the US Department of Justice into Epstein on Sunday. On Monday, Trump said he would sign the measure if it reached his desk. Continue reading...
items.content: President drops opposition to vote that would compel files’ release and says he would sign measure if it reaches his deskUS politics live: House to vote on release of Epstein filesThe Republican-controlled US House of Representatives is expected to vote on Tuesday to force the release of investigative files related to pedophile Jeffrey Epstein, the latest move in a scandal that has dogged Donald Trump since he returned to the White House.In a sharp reversal this weekend, Trump dropped his opposition to a vote releasing files from the criminal investigation by the US Department of Justice into Epstein on Sunday. On Monday, Trump said he would sign the measure if it reached his desk. Continue reading...

items.title: After months of infighting, House GOP could vote today to release the Epstein files
items.standfirst: President Trump has pushed back against releasing the files, but shifted course over the weekend after it became clear the measure was likely to pass the House.
items.content: President Trump has pushed back against releasing the files, but shifted course over the weekend after it became clear the measure was likely to pass the House. (Image credit: Saul Loeb)

Released documents revealed personal correspondence between Summers and the convicted sex offender.

clusters.title: Trump hosts Saudi Prince for first time since Khashoggi murder
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump says he will approve sale of F-35 fighter jets to Saudi Arabia
bullet_summary: The Trump Organization said it’s partnering with a Saudi-owned developer ahead of Mohammed bin Salman’s visit to the White House
Reported by France24, CBS News, Reuters Top News and others

items.title: Trump hosts Saudi Prince for first time since Khashoggi murder
items.standfirst: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman will receive a lavish welcome from US President Donald Trump on Tuesday as the two leaders sign defence and nuclear agreements during the prince’s first visit to the United States since the 2018 killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi. Despite not being the kingdom’s head of state, MBS is expected to be honoured with state-level pageantry, including a fly-by, cannon salute and a formal gala dinner, underscoring the unusually grand reception planned by the White House. France24 correspondent Fraser Jackson shares his insights.
items.content: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman will receive a lavish welcome from US President Donald Trump on Tuesday as the two leaders sign defence and nuclear agreements during the prince’s first visit to the United States since the 2018 killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi. Despite not being the kingdom’s head of state, MBS is expected to be honoured with state-level pageantry, including a fly-by, cannon salute and a formal gala dinner, underscoring the unusually grand reception planned by the White House. France24 correspondent Fraser Jackson shares his insights.

items.standfirst: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman will receive a lavish welcome from US President Donald Trump on Tuesday as the two leaders sign defence and nuclear agreements during the prince’s first visit to the United States since the 2018 killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi. Despite not being the kingdom’s head of state, MBS is expected to be honoured with state-level pageantry, including a fly-by, cannon salute and a formal gala dinner, underscoring the unusually grand reception planned by the White House. France24 International Affairs Editor Philip Turle shares his insights.
items.content: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman will receive a lavish welcome from US President Donald Trump on Tuesday as the two leaders sign defence and nuclear agreements during the prince’s first visit to the United States since the 2018 killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi. Despite not being the kingdom’s head of state, MBS is expected to be honoured with state-level pageantry, including a fly-by, cannon salute and a formal gala dinner, underscoring the unusually grand reception planned by the White House. clusters.title: Ousted Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina sentenced to death for crimes against humanity
clusters.neutral_headline: Moment Ex-Bangladesh leader Sheikh Hasina's sentence is announced
bullet_summary: Reported by Guardian World, BBC World, Sky News World

items.title: Ousted Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina sentenced to death for crimes against humanity
items.standfirst: Hasina sentenced in absentia by court in Dhaka over deadly crackdown on student-led uprising last yearBangladesh’s deposed prime minister Sheikh Hasina has been sentenced to death in absentia by a court in Dhaka for crimes against humanity over a deadly crackdown on a student-led uprising last year.A three-judge bench of the country’s international crimes tribunal convicted Hasina of crimes including incitement, orders to kill and inaction to prevent atrocities as she oversaw a crackdown on anti-government protesters last year. Continue reading...
items.content: Hasina sentenced in absentia by court in Dhaka over deadly crackdown on student-led uprising last yearBangladesh’s deposed prime minister Sheikh Hasina has been sentenced to death in absentia by a court in Dhaka for crimes against humanity over a deadly crackdown on a student-led uprising last year.A three-judge bench of the country’s international crimes tribunal convicted Hasina of crimes including incitement, orders to kill and inaction to prevent atrocities as she oversaw a crackdown on anti-government protesters last year. Continue reading...

items.title: Moment Ex-Bangladesh leader Sheikh Hasina's sentence is announced
items.standfirst: Hasina has called the court's decision "biased and politically motivated" in a statement released after the verdict.
items.content: Hasina has called the court's decision "biased and politically motivated" in a statement released after the verdict.

items.title: Eight firms under investigation in crackdown on additional online fees
items.standfirst: Competition watchdog examines StubHub, Viagogo, AA Driving School and BSM Driving School and othersBusiness live – latest updatesBritain’s competition watchdog has begun investigations into eight companies about their online pricing practices, expressing concern over additional fees and sales tactics such as “drip pricing” and “pressure selling”.The Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) said it was looking into the ticket sellers StubHub and Viagogo; AA Driving School and BSM Driving School; the US gym chain Gold’s Gym; and the retailers Wayfair, Appliances Direct and Marks Electrical. Continue reading...

clusters.neutral_headline: Canada narrowly approves Carney's first federal budget
bullet_summary: Reported by France24, BBC World

items.title: Canadian PM passes first budget: Mark Carney's relied on opposition support or abstentions
items.standfirst: Canada’s parliament has narrowly approved a contentious budget, ensuring the political survival of Prime Minister Mark Carney, who relied on opposition support or abstentions to see the bill through. Carney argues the budget is essential to stimulate the economy and cushion the impact of Donald Trump’s tariffs. Julien Dubois and Oliver Farry report.
items.content: Canada’s parliament has narrowly approved a contentious budget, ensuring the political survival of Prime Minister Mark Carney, who relied on opposition support or abstentions to see the bill through. Carney argues the budget is essential to stimulate the economy and cushion the impact of Donald Trump’s tariffs. Julien Dubois and Oliver Farry report.

items.title: Canada narrowly approves Carney's first federal budget
items.standfirst: The approval of the fiscal plan - the second largest in Canada's history - allows the prime minister's minority government to avert an early election.
items.content: The approval of the fiscal plan - the second largest in Canada's history - allows the prime minister's minority government to avert an early election.

items.title: Canada’s minority government survives cliffhanger budget vote
items.standfirst: Canada’s Liberal government narrowly avoided collapse on Monday as Prime Minister Mark Carney’s budget squeaked through a confidence vote. Opposition divisions and a desire to avoid an early election helped the minority Liberals secure enough support and abstentions to pass the high-stakes fiscal plan.
items.content: Canada’s Liberal government narrowly avoided collapse on Monday as Prime Minister Mark Carney’s budget squeaked through a confidence vote. Opposition divisions and a desire to avoid an early election helped the minority Liberals secure enough support and abstentions to pass the high-stakes fiscal plan.

clusters.title: Nestle accused of risking baby health in Africa
clusters.neutral_headline: Nestle accused of risking baby health in Africa
bullet_summary: Reported by Al Jazeera, Guardian World

items.title: Nestle accused of risking baby health in Africa
items.standfirst: NGO says Swiss food giant is 'putting the health of babies at risk for profit' by adding sugar to babyfood.
items.content: NGO says Swiss food giant is 'putting the health of babies at risk for profit' by adding sugar to babyfood.

items.title: Nestlé accused of ’risking health of babies for profit’ over added sugar in cereals sold in African countries
items.standfirst: Campaigners say the company is contributing to rising rates of childhood obesity, while the firm says it is helping to combat malnutritionNestlé is still adding sugar to most baby cereals sold across Africa, according to an investigation by campaigners who have accused the company of “putting the health of African babies at risk for profit”.The food firm was accused of “double standards” over the researchers’ findings, which come at a time when rates of childhood obesity are rising on the continent, prompting calls for Nestlé to remove all added sugar from baby-food products. Continue reading...
items.content: Campaigners say the company is contributing to rising rates of childhood obesity, while the firm says it is helping to combat malnutritionNestlé is still adding sugar to most baby cereals sold across Africa, according to an investigation by campaigners who have accused the company of “putting the health of African babies at risk for profit”.The food firm was accused of “double standards” over the researchers’ findings, which come at a time when rates of childhood obesity are rising on the continent, prompting calls for Nestlé to remove all added sugar from baby-food products. clusters.title: Philippine President Marcos rejects sister’s accusation of chronic drug use
clusters.neutral_headline: Philippine President Marcos rejects sister’s accusation of chronic drug use
bullet_summary: Reported by Al Jazeera, Guardian World

items.title: Philippine President Marcos rejects sister’s accusation of chronic drug use
items.standfirst: Philippine president faces accusation of chronic drug use amid a major corruption scandal over flood-control projects.
items.content: Philippine president faces accusation of chronic drug use amid a major corruption scandal over flood-control projects.

items.title: Philippine president Marcos denies estranged sister’s claim he is a cocaine addict
items.standfirst: Communications undersecretary Claire Castro says claims from the president’s sister may be an attempt to distract from investigations into a corruption scandal Philippine president Ferdinand Marcos Jr has denied accusations made by his estranged sister that he is longtime drug addict, whose alleged cocaine dependence has led to governance issues, including corruption, a spokesperson for the president has said.Communications undersecretary Claire Castro described the comments by the president’s sister, senator Imee Marcos’, as baseless, and suggested they may have been a desperate attempt to distract ongoing investigations into a corruption scandal involving flood control projects that may implicate her allies in the Senate. Continue reading...
items.content: Communications undersecretary Claire Castro says claims from the president’s sister may be an attempt to distract from investigations into a corruption scandal Philippine president Ferdinand Marcos Jr has denied accusations made by his estranged sister that he is longtime drug addict, whose alleged cocaine dependence has led to governance issues, including corruption, a spokesperson for the president has said.Communications undersecretary Claire Castro described the comments by the president’s sister, senator Imee Marcos’, as baseless, and suggested they may have been a desperate attempt to distract ongoing investigations into a corruption scandal involving flood control projects that may implicate her allies in the Senate. clusters.title: Man charged with murder of Oakland football coach John Beam
clusters.neutral_headline: Man charged with murder of Oakland football coach John Beam
bullet_summary: Cedric Irving Jr, who does not have a criminal record, was charged with murder and use of a gun during the crime, Alameda county district attorney Ursula Jones Dickson said at a news conference
The man accused in the killing of beloved Laney College athletic director John Beam in Oakland was charged with murder on Monday, and faces gun enhancement count as well, authorities said

items.title: Man charged with murder of Oakland football coach John Beam
items.standfirst: Cedric Irving Jr, 27, charged over death of ‘legend’ Beam, who was shot and killed on Laney College campus last weekA 27-year-old man was charged on Monday with the murder of the beloved Oakland football coach John Beam, who died last week after being shot in the head on the junior college campus in northern California where he worked.Cedric Irving Jr, who does not have a criminal record, was charged with murder and use of a gun during the crime, Alameda county district attorney Ursula Jones Dickson said at a news conference. Continue reading...
items.content: Cedric Irving Jr, 27, charged over death of ‘legend’ Beam, who was shot and killed on Laney College campus last weekA 27-year-old man was charged on Monday with the murder of the beloved Oakland football coach John Beam, who died last week after being shot in the head on the junior college campus in northern California where he worked.Cedric Irving Jr, who does not have a criminal record, was charged with murder and use of a gun during the crime, Alameda county district attorney Ursula Jones Dickson said at a news conference. Continue reading...

clusters.title: New blow for Louvre as structural problem forces gallery closure
clusters.neutral_headline: New blow for Louvre as structural problem forces gallery closure
bullet_summary: Reported by Guardian World, BBC World

items.title: New blow for Louvre as structural problem forces gallery closure
items.standfirst: Campana Gallery is temporarily shut due to weaknesses in beams supporting floor above The Louvre has temporarily closed one of its galleries as a precaution after an audit revealed structural weaknesses in some of the beams in the building.The Campana Gallery, which houses nine rooms dedicated to ancient Greek ceramics, will be shut while investigations are conducted into “certain beams supporting the floors of the second floor” above it, a statement issued on Monday said. Continue reading...
items.content: Campana Gallery is temporarily shut due to weaknesses in beams supporting floor above The Louvre has temporarily closed one of its galleries as a precaution after an audit revealed structural weaknesses in some of the beams in the building.The Campana Gallery, which houses nine rooms dedicated to ancient Greek ceramics, will be shut while investigations are conducted into “certain beams supporting the floors of the second floor” above it, a statement issued on Monday said. Continue reading...

items.title: Louvre closes gallery due to structural issue
items.standfirst: The Campana Gallery, which host Greek ceramics, will remain closed as beams supporting the floor above are checked.
items.content: The Campana Gallery, which host Greek ceramics, will remain closed as beams supporting the floor above are checked.

items.content: Shoppers can browse Ford dealers' used car selection online, through Amazon Autos, and pick their vehicles up in person.

items.title: Ford Taps Amazon to Let Shoppers Buy Its Used Cars Online
items.standfirst: Ford Motor Co. has struck a deal with Amazon.com Inc. to sell certified used cars through its e-commerce website, becoming the second major automaker to reach customers through the massive online retailer.
items.content: Ford Motor Co. has struck a deal with Amazon.com Inc. to sell certified used cars through its e-commerce website, becoming the second major automaker to reach customers through the massive online retailer.
